ORAL ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS ( ) (The Hon. Speaker) 1 -1]0]/2024- (1) - [ .]
( ) (The Hon. Vasudeva Nanayakkara) . ( ) (The Hon. Prasanna Ranatunga) .
PRODUCTION AND EXPORT OF TEA: DETAILS
asked the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries:

(a) Will he inform this House - (i) the total area of land where tea is cultivated in Sri Lanka; (ii) separately, the extent of land owned by the State sector and the private sector, out of the said area; (iii) the annual income earned from tea production; (iv) the names of the areas where tea is cultivated using organic fertilizer; and (v) the annual yield of tea obtained using organic fertilizer?

(b) Will he also inform this House of the - (i) names of the countries to which Sri Lanka exports tea; (ii) quantity of tea exported annually; (iii) annual amount of foreign exchange earned from the said exportation; and (iv) ranking for Ceylon Tea in the world tea market?
( - ) (The Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera- Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries) ,.
. . Question ordered to stand down. ( ) (The Hon. Speaker) ] -2042/2024- (2) - [ .]
MOUNT LAVINIA BUS STATION: REASONS FOR REMOVAL
( - ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Tissa Attanayake) - (1):
asked the Minister of Transport and Highways:
(i) the reasons for the removal of the Mount Lavinia main bus station, where operations were carried out by the Ratmalana Depot;
(ii) name of the original owner and the plan number of the land acquired for establishing the aforesaid main bus station;
(iii) the extent of the aforesaid land;
(iv) the extent of the land used for establishing the aforesaid main bus station;
(v) the year in which the land was acquired for establishing the main bus station; and
(vi) the institution which owns the aforesaid land, at present?
( - . ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Premnath C. Dolawatte, Attorney-at-Law) - (1):
(i) the number of pharmacies owned by the State Pharmaceuticals Corporation in the Colombo District;
(ii) the address of each of the said pharmacy, separately; and
(iii) the actions that will be taken to expand the network of State Pharmaceutical Corporation pharmacies in the Colombo District?
( - () ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. (Mrs.) Rajika Wickramasinghe) - (2):
asked the Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment:
(i) the number of complaints received by the Department of Labour regarding labour disputes from the year 2020 to date;
(ii) the number of settled and unsettled complaints, separately; and
(iii) the number of persons who have received compensation through the Office of the Commissioner for Workmen's Compensation?
( - ) (The Hon. Manusha Nanayakkara- Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment) -
( ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana) Thank you. ( ) (The Hon. Manusha Nanayakkara) * .
2015 : IMPORT AND PRODUCTION OF DAIRY PRODUCTS FROM 2015:
( - ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Milan Jayathilake) - (1):
asked the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries:
(i) separately, the volume of dairy products imported to Sri Lanka from the year 2015 to date, according to each year;
(ii) the annual volume of dairy production in Sri Lanka;
(iii) the annual volume of dairy production in Sri Lanka, as a percentage of the volume of dairy production required by Sri Lanka annually; and
(iv) the province that has recorded the highest consumption of dairy products?
(b) Will he also inform this House -
(i) area that has recorded highest dairy production;
(ii) measures that will be taken to increase the dairy production of Sri Lanka?
EMPLOYEES OF THE SRI LANKA CUSTOMS: SALARIES AND
( - .. ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. U.K. Sumith Udukumbura) , - (1):
asked the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies:
(i) the approved cadre of the Sri Lanka Customs;
(ii) separately, the number of employees of the Sri Lanka Customs and the number of employees of the Combined Service;
(iii) the amount of monthly salary and allowances paid to the executive officers and junior officers of the Sri Lanka Customs, separately according to each position; and
(iv) the amount of monthly salary and allowances paid to the executive officers and junior officers of the Combined Service, separately according to each position?
(b) If not, why? ( - ) (The Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya - Minister of State Plantation Enterprises Reforms and State Minister of Finance) , , * .
RETIRED PUBLIC SERVANTS: PAYMENT OF PENSION
( - ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Lalith Ellawala) - (2):
asked the Prime Minister and Minister of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Government:
(i) it takes over ten months to commence the payment of monthly pension to public servants after their retirement from the Public Service;
(ii) there are instances of certain public servants passing away before receiving their first pension owing to the said delay; and
(iii) the said delay is a severe injustice to the public servants?
(i) the reasons for the said delay;
(ii) the steps taken by now to avoid the said delay;
(iii) whether a proper programme will be implemented to avoid the said delay; and
(iv) if so, the date on which such programme will be implemented?
(c) If not, why? ( - ) (The Hon. Ashoka Priyantha - State Minister of Home Affairs) . , .
( - ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Velu Kumar) - (2):
asked the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs:
(i) the Kandy City has been declared as a world heritage site by the UNESCO; and
(ii) numerous historically important places of Sri Lanka are located in the aforementioned city?
(i) the sacred places and buildings situated in Kandy City which have been recognized as the world heritages;
(ii) whether financial aid will be granted by the UNESO to protect the aforesaid places;
(iii) if so, the total amount of financial aid granted annually;
(iv) the private buildings situated in Kandy City which have been recognized as the world heritages;
(v) whether any financial aid will be granted for the owners of the said buildings; and
(vi) if so, the amount of the financial aid mentioned above?
(c) Will he also inform this House -
(i) whether places mentioned in above (b)(i) will remain the same;
(ii) whether approval has been granted for any renovation made in them; and
(iii) the programmes that have been implemented to keep/continue the Kandy City as a world heritage site?
( - , ) (The Hon. Vidura Wickramanayaka - Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs) * .

Hon. Presiding Member, I would also like to say a few words in relation to the plantation companies constantly saying that they are making losses, they would not be able to sustain the industry, that the industry would collapse and constantly threatening the Government and the people in Sri Lanka that if a wage increase is given to the workers, the industry would not be sustainable and would collapse. That is utter nonsense! In my hand, I have a document showing the profits and losses of those companies. Of the 19 companies, just to name a few, the Agarapatana Plantations Limited has made a profit of Rs. 1.782 billion. Similarly, the Kelani Valley Plantations has made a profit of Rs. 2.087 billion, the Kotagala

Plantations, Rs. 252 million, the Hapugastenna Plantations, Rs. 159 million, the Elpitiya Plantations, Rs. 1.8 billion and the Talawakale Plantations, Rs. 2.57 billion. With these profits, are you telling me that the industry would collapse?

The sustainability of an industry should not be based on the exploitation of labour working there. If that is the case, then let the industry collapse. We are very confident that it would not. Those companies cannot constantly make empty threats like that. At the end of the day, if they are not able to look after their workers and if there is a worker shortage today, it is purely because of the inefficiency of the administration in those companies. There were 535,000 workers 20 years ago. Why is there only 115,000 right now? It is because there is no dignity in that labour; there is no recognition and respect for that labour. That is why I stand before this House and urge this House that when it comes to a marginalized community, do not to look at them as a mere political vote bank but as a marginalized community who need equitable access to justice. Thank you.
. . Seconded. . . Question put, and agreed to.

( ) (The Hon. Wasantha Yapabandara, Attorney-at-Law) Thank you very much for giving me this opportunity, Hon. Presiding Member.

First of all, I would also like to take this opportunity to appreciate the Government for bringing in Amendments to Sections 9, 18 and 33 of the Sri Lanka Telecommunications Act. Since we have come closer to an election, what would happen? The governing party would misuse the media. So, once again, I appreciate the Government for bringing in Amendments to this Act at a time like this. And, when we come closer to the election, we would realize how exactly this would come into effect.

That is why I say, Sir, that we need to improve and expand the telecommunication sector. Actually in those days, we had a problem regarding fuel distribution and they developed a very important QR system for that. I think in most sectors, we need to have growth. We need a highly improved telecommunication system. Improvement should not be limited only to the telecommunication sector, but also in the agriculture and other sectors, we need highly improved technical systems introduced.

It being past 5.30 p.m., THE HON. PRESIDING MEMBER adjourned Parliament without Question put.
Parliament adjourned accordingly at 6.23 p.m. until 9.30 a.m. on Wednesday, 10th July, 2024.
